articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
The ice cream planet of Creamy Canyon holds many Astro Bot secrets, with a total of 11 collectibles. They'll be relatively easy to spot with the handy bird guide; however, you may be stumped with the Lost Galaxy hint. We're here to help by showing you how to unlock the Creamy Canyon Lost Galaxy in Astro Bot, including where to find its collectibles.


How to find the Creamy Canyon Lost Galaxy in Astro Bot


Once you enter the Creamy Canyon in the Gorilla Nebula, you'll encounter a walrus ice sculpture just before the second checkpoint. You may be inclined to hit it, as I did, but unfortunately, the Astro Bot's little punches just won't cut it.


Screenshot by Destructoid


For it to work, you must grab the nearby robotic pig and throw it toward the sculpture to unlock Creamy Canyon's Lost …
articles.title: How to unlock Creamy Canyon Lost Galaxy in Astro Bot

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Over the years, I've been watching Astro Bot's career with interest. The series had humble tech demo origins, and now, it's a full-on mascot platformer.


This little bot has a lot of potential, and now with a full game under its wing, developer Team Asobi has managed to knock it out of the park — and then some.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Astro Bot (PS5 [Reviewed])
Developer: Team Asobi
Publisher: Sony Interactive Entertainment
Released: September 6, 2024
MSRP: $59.99


Astro Bot may go the traditional "level select" platformer route, but there's a lot under the hood as you continue through the roughly 10-hour core adventure. I'm not going to spoil basically anything from said adventure, including all of the cameos, Sony homage levels, and challenge-esque bonus stages, so don't worry ab…
articles.title: Review: Astro Bot (2024)

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The shot meter has undergone a massive change in NBA 2K25, as developer Visual Concepts not only gave the feature a new UI makeover but changed up how the meter feels, too. 


You'll no longer have the old meter system with a green portion towards the top. Instead, the visual cue is now available as an arrow/ring/circle to help time shots better. Like NBA 2K24, the shot meter, or its current iteration, is always on by default. However, now the gauge can be toggled either off or on, in addition to its new visual options.  


How to disable the shot meter in NBA 2K25


You can make the change from either the MyTeam or MyCareer settings. 



Go to "Settings".


Choose "Customize HUD".


Select "Shot Meter Shots".


The first three options in this section deal with the visibility of the shot meter. They're basic shots, layups, and free throws.


You have to turn off the jump meter for the different shots manually.



That's all you have to do to remove the shot meter from being activated when you attempt any throw.


Image via Destructoid


Should you turn off the shot meter in NBA 2K25?


Despite a change in its old shape, the shot meter is pretty helpful for beginners. However, I certainly feel that the old meter was much more useful. Adjusting to the new arrow can be tricky, and I have actually switched to the ring meter.


That said, you'll get a 10% bonus for a successful basket for every green-timed shot with the meter turned off. In the long run, you'll want to learn to time the throws on your own without having to rely on the meter. It's not only for the success bonus; every good player knows the art of timing your throws to score a basket in NBA 2K25.


Hence, turning off the meter is the way to go forward, even if you might struggle to time your throws at first. I have the meter turned on for layups and free throws only. For jump shots, I depend on my sense of timing and the visual cue from player animations on the screen.

The post How to turn off shot meter for NBA 2K25 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to turn off shot meter for NBA 2K25

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
Lethal Company developer Zeekerss released the Patch Notes and update for Version 64 of the popular survival game today, indicating that while the patch is a smaller one, he wanted to get it out as soon as possible because it has a couple of nice features. Here are all the details we know about about Lethal Company Version 64 and the Patch Notes for the update titled The Bag Patch.





Lethal Company Update 64 Patch Notes


Compared to previous updates, Version 64 for Lethal Company is a rather small update. However, as Zeekerss mentioned, it does have some pretty important additions such as a new item, a new rare weather event, and a ton of bug fixes. According to Zeekerss, he's been spending a lot of time working on another project, titled Welcome to the Dark Place, with hopes of finishing it soon.


The last two versions were mostly bug fixes, and so is Version 64, but with at least two new pieces of content, it's a great update for Lethal Company fans to get back into it. Here are the full Lethal Company Version 64 Patch Notes, for the update titled The Bag Patch:



New Tactical Belt Bag - The tactical belt bag can now be bought from the terminal. It holds 15 non-scrap items and can be accessed by other players while it's around your waist. Use "INFO" to learn more about it.


Rare Weather Event - A new, rare 0.6% chance weather event can now occur on any day at a random time.


Bug Fixes - A few bug fixes.



While Zeekerss didn't go into detail about the bug fixes, it's typically changes that overall improve the quality of the game by fixing the rare bug or issue that may occur when playing Lethal Company. The Version 64 update is live now on PC via Steam.

The post Lethal Company Version 64 Patch Notes – The Bag Patch appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Lethal Company Version 64 Patch Notes – The Bag Patch

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
In turn-based mythological RPG Dislyte, there are many characters each receiving constant balance changes with each update. Called Espers, these mythical superheroes each have unique powers and builds that allow them to shine in either PvE or PvP situations. We've put together this Dislyte Tier List of Characters so you know which Espers you should go for.


Image via Dislyte


Dislyte Tier List


With over 80 characters in total, Dislyte now has plenty of options in terms of which Espers to use across all four of the different factions. While some characters might have specific situations in which they shine, such as Story, Cube, Temporal Tower, Point War, and more, this Tier List focuses on the overall strength of each Esper as a whole. 


As such, characters in the S Tier can compete in…
articles.title: Dislyte Tier List of Characters

articles.author: Moulik Mathur
articles.description:
Pokémon Go Max Out, the new season, is set to introduce Dynamax Pokémon and Max Battles next week. Ahead of that, we have first received Max Particles and Power Spots which are now live in Pokémon Go. But what are Max Particles and Power Spots in Pokémon Go?


Well, for players to take part in Max Battles, they will require Max Particles. These are essentially components you can earn in the game to take part in Max Battles. Power Spots are locations where Max Battles take place in Pokémon Go.


Image via Niantic


Niantic has given players time to collect Max Particles from Power Spots so that they can be ready to take part in Max Battles next week, and collected Dynamax Pokémon.


How to collect Max Particles from Power Spots in Pokémon Go


You can collect Max Particles from a Power Spot…
articles.title: What are Max Particles and Power Spots in Pokémon Go

articles.author: Sourav Banik
articles.description:
Winged Keys are one of the common currencies in Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions that you can earn in several ways and they help you unlock different characters, wands, broom trails, and more.


Unlike the Firebolt, you need these Winged Keys to unlock certain iconic characters from Harry Potter movies such as Draco Malfoy and Cedric Diggory. They cost a certain amount and earning this currency is not as easy as earning Gold and Moonstones.


Fortunately, there are a handful of ways to earn Winged Keys, and here's how you can do that.


Screenshot by Destructoid


How to earn Winged Keys Quidditch Champions


There are two ways of earning Winged Keys:



Complete Daily and Weekly Challenges


Reach different milestones in Seasonal events



Completing Daily challenges such as playing five PvP matches, winning a game, completing assists, or more can fetch you 2 to 3 Winged Keys. Weekly challenges on the other hand take longer to complete and reward you with 7 to 10 Winged Keys.


The current Season has several milestones and reaching at least level 50 will get you 100 Winged Keys in total. You can continue leveling up; each level beyond 50 will give you 10 of this currency.


Screenshot by Destructoid


How to use Winged Keys in Quidditch Champions


Once you have enough Winged Keys stacked up, you can head to The Vault under Market to spend them on characters such as Draco Malfoy, Cedric Diggory, Ginny Weasley, and Cho Chang. They are known as the Heroes of Hogwarts and each of their bundles cost 250x Winged Keys.


These characters have their dedicated bundles in the store which also offer other items such as styled wands, house-wise goal celebrations, and colored broom trails.


Winged Keys are the enchanted Flying Keys you've read in Harry Potter: Philosopher's Stone. Just like the series, Winged Keys are equally rare to get in Quidditch Champions, and have many uses we've mentioned above.

The post How to get Winged Keys in Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to get Winged Keys in Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions

articles.author: Moulik Mathur
articles.description:
Carrier AI Fragment is an interactive component in No Man’s Sky, which is primarily used to detect crashed Sentinel Interceptors in the game. Players can find Carrier AI Fragment in No Man’s Sky through a variety of ways.


However, the method which guarantees Carrier AI Fragment is go after the Sentinel Capital Ships, and destroy them. A Sentinel Capital Ship is the last sentinel force sent against the player when they’re fighting sentinels in space. A Sentinel Capital Ship arrives at a level 5 wanted level. This freighter comes with regular Sentinel Interceptors to defeat the player.





You have to damage the hull of the freighter and destroy it, which will also cause nearby Sentinel Interceptors to retreat. You will receive the Carrier AI Fragment among other items as loot for defeating the Sentinel Capital Ship.


There are also other ways in No Man’s Sky where you might stumble upon a Carrier AI Fragment, but the chances are slim. Nexus missions can sometimes offer Carrier AI Fragment as reward for completing a task. You might also receive Carrier AI Fragment as loot from successful combat frigate expeditions.


Video via Hello Games


Regardless, the chances for both of these scenarios are slim, so if you are specifically looking for Carrier AI Fragment, your guaranteed way of obtaining it is by defeating the Sentinel Capital Ship.


Defeating Sentinel Interceptors, then the Sentinel Capital Ship is not as easy task to accomplish, so make sure your starship is equipped with enough shields and weapons technology upgrades to aid you well in battle. It’s best to equip a starship with maneuverability and upgrade it with technology and weapons, as large inventory ships move and turn way slower than sleek, combat ships.

The post No Man’s Sky: How to get Carrier AI Fragment appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: No Man’s Sky: How to get Carrier AI Fragment

articles.author: Moulik Mathur
articles.description:
Pokémon Go new season, dubbed Max Out, is now live. The Pokémon Go Max Out season brings with it a new Special Research for players to take part in, and players are required to choose a path in order to complete this research.


The Galar Calling Special Research story asks players to choose between three starter Pokémon: Grookey, Scorbunny or Sobble. While it is possible to catch all three of these Pokémon during this research, the choice will impact the rewards players earn during this research.


So, which path should you choose in Pokémon Go for the Galar Calling Special Research story? Here’s a breakdown for each of the choices.




Grookey


Grookey is your best choice between the lot, if you prioritize Pokémon Go Trainer Battles the most when you play Pokémon Go. Given that all thre…
articles.title: Pokemon Go: Which path to choose for Galar Calling research — Grookey, Scorbunny or Sobble

articles.author: Cameron Woolsey
articles.description:
The makers of the Silent Hill 2 remake have announced that the game will not only ship with a grainy '90s filter, but it also includes an option to dunk the UI completely for that sweet nostalgia factor. Granted, a toggle to drop the UI isn't exactly innovation defined. But it should increase the spooky immersion of the horror game.


Bloober revealed the options earlier today on its social media channels. I'll be the first to say that the tiny screens on X/Twitter and Instagram don't really do the footage much justice. But take it from someone who spent the last 40 seconds with their face against the monitor, the filter does give the video an eerie quality. Or maybe that's just the poor encoder? Feel free to make the judgment yourself:




Nodding along to the horror song


Bloober Team w…
articles.title: Silent Hill 2 dev is adding a ’90s filter and an option to remove UI for nostalgic fans

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
One of the most enjoyable parts of Disney Dreamlight Valley is cooking, especially when you unlock a new ingredient and experiment with different combinations to see what works. The End of Summer event brings this to the next level by introducing marshmallows, which you'll use to share and savor some deliciously sweet desserts.


How to finish the Savor Some Sweetness duty in Disney Dreamlight Valley


Completing the Savor Some Sweetness duty requires making and eating s'mores during the End of Summer event. S'mores is a four-star meal requiring pink and blue marshmallows, which you'll find growing from Plaza bushes and as a ground item.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Much like Share Some Sweetness, you'll need to make 25 s'mores dishes for this task. However, rather than sharing them with …
articles.title: How to complete Savor Some Sweetness in Disney Dreamlight Valley

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Disney Dreamlight Valley is about sharing joy with others, from completing friendship quests to giving your villagers their favorite gifts. During the game's End of Summer event, you'll get another opportunity to show your care by collecting and sharing marshmallows in exchange for a special reward.


How to finish the Share Some Sweetness duty in Disney Dreamlight Valley


Completing the Share Some Sweetness duty requires finding marshmallows, turning them into Roasted Marshmallows, and sharing them with your villagers during the End of Summer event. You'll need pink and blue marshmallows to make the meal, which you can then gift to any character in Dreamlight Valley. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


The End of Summer event introduced two marshmallow recipes:



S'mores


Roasted Marshmallo…
articles.title: How to complete Share Some Sweetness in Disney Dreamlight Valley

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The Second Circuit Court of Appeals has dealt a blow to the Internet Archive's digital book lending program. The court upheld a lower court's decision, stating that IA's practice of scanning and lending copyrighted books without permission is not fair use. IA's lending program directly threatens the revenues of publishers and violates copyright law, the judges ruled.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Internet Archive Loses Landmark E-Book Lending Copyright Appeal Against Publishers

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Major sports rightsholders and broadcasters in Canada have selected UK-based site-blocking veterans Friend MTS to carry out all pirate IPTV blocking under a Federal Court injunction obtained during the summer. The fact that NHL, NBA, and Premier League streams will be blocked by major Canadian ISPs was widely reported. Yet, with significantly less fanfare, it appears that the UFC and MLB have also entered the blocking arena.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: UFC & MLB Join Pirate IPTV Blocking as Broadcasters Collaborate to Cut Costs

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
This weekend, popular torrent site TorrentGalaxy went 'offline' displaying an image that some interpreted as a farewell message. Today the site returned and uploads at third-party sites resumed simultaneously. This is the second time in a few weeks that the site has gone through this mysterious cycle. The main question that remains: Why?
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: TorrentGalaxy is Back Online & Uploads Resume

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
After obtaining an injunction and an invasive search and seizure order at Canada's Federal Court, teams from Bell, Rogers, Disney, Paramount, Columbia, and Warner Bros. targeted the alleged operators of IPTV service SmoothStreams at their homes in Canada. The defendants were charged with contempt of court when they failed to comply with the terms of the order. Two years later, the defendants are paying a heavy price and the main case hasn't even started.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Bell, Rogers & MPA’s Pirate IPTV Lawsuit is a Slow-Motion Money Pit Nightmare

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Nhentai, a popular adult site with dozens of millions of monthly visits, has been sued for copyright infringement. The lawsuit was filed by California company PCR Distributing, which operates several hentai brands. The complaint alleges that nhentai doesn't respond to takedown notices. The site attempted to settle the dispute confidentially months ago, but that attempt failed. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘Pirate’ Site nHentai Sued in U.S. Court for Copyright Infringement

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
A co-founder of a group, formed to raise awareness of "damaging" religious instruction received by schoolchildren in the U.S., now has support from the Electronic Frontier Foundation. After Zachary Parrish published the LifeWise Academy's children's curriculum on the website of 'Parents Against LifeWise' he was sued for copyright infringement. In support of a motion to dismiss, EFF says that copyright law isn't a tool to silence critics and a fair use defense will prevail.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: EFF Assists Critic’s Fair Use Defense Over Kids’ Religious Program ‘Leak’

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Cheat seller AimJunkies has suffered two new setbacks in its legal battle with 'Destiny 2' developer Bungie. The Seattle District Court refused to overturn a jury verdict issued in May and will not grant a new trial. Separately, the Court of Appeals affirmed a $4.3 million arbitration award, concluding that no clear errors were made and that the scale of the award is not “completely irrational”
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Court Denies Cheat Seller AimJunkies a New Trial, Affirms Bungie’s $4.3m Win

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Inside Out 2' tops the chart, followed by 'Borderlands'. 'Trap' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 09/02/2024

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The spectacular demise of Fmovies, Aniwave, and a dozen or more related big-brand pirate sites, has former users asking the same question: Are they really gone forever? With many resurrections and Dr. Who-like regenerations over recent years, some seem optimistic. Government records suggests that business bridges are being built from Hollywood to Vietnam, and back again. It seems unlikely that the resurrection of pirate sites would help in any way.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Fmovies & Aniwave: Will The Masters of Pirate Resurrection Rise Again?

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Popular torrent site TorrentGalaxy once again confuses users with a mysterious message. Instead of the usual list of downloads, it simply shows an image from the film Logan and the brief message "TG Forever". This is similar to a notice that appeared on the site a few weeks ago, after which it eventually resumed business as usual. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: TorrentGalaxy Spooks Users with More ‘Downtime’

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Earlier this month, U.S. law enforcement seized several domain names belonging to popular sports streaming site Streameast. However, instead of shutting down operations, the site is fighting back. After launching new backup domains, the site's operators inform TorrentFreak that they plan to challenge the seizure warrant in court.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Sports Streaming Site Streameast Plans to Appeal U.S. Domain Name Seizures

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Despite malware having an even worse reputation than piracy, until now police operations to take sites down, explicitly because they're involved in both, have been pretty much non-existent. This week, music industry group IFPI revealed Operation Redirect, "the first operation of its kind in Brazil to target illegal sites associated with malware distribution." Intrigued by the announcement, we took a closer look and found plenty of drama.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Operation Redirect: Police Anti-Malware Action Protects Music & Pirates

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Fmovies, one of the most popular pirate streaming sites of recent times, disappeared a few weeks ago. No credit was taken by authorities or rightsholders, not even when related giants including AniWave fell this week. Today, initial suspicions are confirmed; anti-piracy group ACE says it assisted Vietnamese authorities to shut down the piracy ring. In parallel, the Vietnamese Government is organizing a promo tour in Hollywood.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Fmovies Piracy Ring Was Shut Down by Vietnam, Assisted By ACE

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
A copyright lawsuit, filed in June by the world's largest educational publishers, accused Google of promoting pirate sites and profiting from piracy, among other things. This week Google responded to the Cengage Learning-led complaint with a motion to dismiss all but one of the publishers' claims, describing them as "tacked on" as part of a "kitchen-sink pleading strategy."
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Google Asks Court to Gut “Kitchen Sink” Lawsuit Claiming it Profits From Piracy

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Fmovies was once the world's most popular pirate streaming site. Then mid-June, after years of smooth sailing, it vanished into thin air. Sites with over a billion annual visits tend not to throw everything away so easily. Yet last night, a site with close to two billion visits disappeared in similar circumstances, rapidly followed by another, and then many others after that. In the absence of an official announcement, earlier today we took an early sift through the wreckage.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate Sites, Billions of Visits, Wiped Out in Hours: Sifting the Fmovies Wreckage

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
After the recent shutdown of Fmovies, right now an entire streaming empire is collapsing. Big name casualties include Fboxz.to, Aniwave.to, Anix.to, AnimeSuge, Zoroxtv, the list goes on. In a message displayed on their homepages, visitors are advised to use legal options from now on. The exact same message appeared when 123movies threw in the towel a few years ago. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate Streaming Giants Fboxz, AniWave, Zoroxtv & Others Dead in Major Collapse

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Claims that Italy will launch Piracy Shield 2.0 at the end of the year appear to be overly optimistic. With just four months left of 2024, a software supplier hasn't even been chosen yet. With the current system falling over, previously blocked domains and IP addresses are being unblocked to make room for new ones, something that the law has no provision for. Meanwhile, smart TV manufacturers will soon be asked to ban a VPN app from their sets.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Piracy Shield 2.0 in Doubt For 2024 , TV Manufacturers Urged to Ban VPN

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Do you know someone who sells dodgy streaming boxes or pirate IPTV streams? In Ireland, anti-piracy group FACT in partnership with Crimestoppers would like you to 'report' this activity. These 'snitch' initiatives are not widely embraced by the public but with a six-week social media push, the campaign aims to identity new enforcement targets.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pssst… Want to Snitch on Sellers of Pirate Streaming Services?

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
"House of the Dragon" is one of the most watched TV series, particularly among pirates. The second season ended earlier this month after the eighth episode, though many fans had hoped for more. Pirates who downloaded the unexpected 'House of the Dragon S02E09' release got a surprise bonus, but not the one they were hoping for. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘Bonus’ Episode of ‘House of the Dragon’ Comes With a Nasty Surprise for Pirates

you can get the update by clicking Help > Check for Updates (or Android Studio > Check
for Updates on macOS). Otherwise, you can download it here.
For information on new features and changes in Android Studio Ladybug, see the Android Studio Preview release notes.

For details of bugs fixed in each previous release of Android Studio Ladybug, see
closed issues.
General fixes and features
Below is a list of general fixes in Android Studio Ladybug | 2024.2.1 Canary 5 and Android Gradle Plugin 8.7.0-alpha05. These are a result of your bug
reports, which help us to make Android Studio better. If you encounter a problem, let us know by reporting a bug. You can also vote for an existing issue to indicate that it also affects
you.

  
    
Fixed Issues
    
Lifecycle
      
        

          
            

              
Issue #341316048
K2 UAST: wrong nullity of resolved lambda parameter with platform type

          
        

      
    
Lint
      
        

          
            

              
Issue #36981231
Lint should check for invalid objects used as ViewGroups

          
        

      
    
Logcat
      
        

          
            

              
Issue #356907818
Logcat Tool Window's text doesn't follow the zoom config in Apperance/Accessiblity
